currencies.description: Earned through gameplay. Used for cosmetics, rerolls, and non-premium items.

anti_inflation.sink_balance: Cost of cosmetics designed to absorb credits over time

currencies.description: Premium currency purchased with real money. Used for battle pass, exclusive cosmetics, and tier skips.

gems_to_credits.description: Emergency conversion for players who want credits immediately

credits_to_gems.reason: Prevents black market issues and maintains gem value

earning_philosophy.free_to_play_viable: F2P players can earn meaningful cosmetics through Credits
earning_philosophy.premium_value: Gems provide convenience and exclusive items, not power
earning_philosophy.no_pay_to_win: No gameplay advantages purchasable with Gems
earning_philosophy.generous_free_rewards: Battle pass free track and challenges provide regular Credits
earning_philosophy.optional_purchases: All premium purchases optional and cosmetic-only

regional_pricing.description: Pricing adjusted for purchasing power parity

first_time_buyer.description: Special offer for first gem purchase

purchase_limits.chargeback_protection: Account flagged on chargeback, gems removed

design_notes.dual_currency_rationale: Separates earnable rewards (Credits) from monetization (Gems) for clarity
design_notes.credits_purpose: Provides F2P progression path and shop engagement without purchases
design_notes.gems_purpose: Monetization without compromising game balance or fairness
design_notes.balance_strategy: Generous credit earning keeps F2P engaged, while exclusive gem items drive conversion
design_notes.psychological_pricing: Packages priced at common price points ($4.99, $9.99, etc.)
design_notes.bonus_tiers: Larger purchases provide bonus gems (10-25%) to incentivize higher spending
references: Valorant VP system for premium currency
Apex Legends Apex Coins for package sizing
League of Legends RP for regional pricing
